revision.comment: Ahmad ibn Tulun Passed A class review
revision.text: {{talkheader}} {{ArticleHistory | action1 = GAN | action1date = 12:06, 13 December 2015 (UTC) | action1link = Talk:Ahmad ibn Tulun/GA1 | action1result = listed | action1oldid = 695045746 | dykdate = 5 January 2016 | dykentry = ... that the Turkish [[ghulam|slave-soldier]] '''[[Ahmad ibn Tulun]]''' established the [[Tulunids|first local dynasty]] to rule Egypt since the Pharaohs? | currentstatus = GA | topic = Royalty, nobility and heraldry |action2=WAR |action2date=13:06, 25 April 2016 (UTC) |action2link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/Ahmad ibn Tulun |action2result=approved |action2oldid=712682778 }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Biography|living=n|class=A|listas=Ahmad Ibn Tulun|military-work-group=y|military-priority=Low|royalty-work-group=y|royalty-priority=Low}} {{WikiProject Military history|class=A|A-Class=pass|Biography=y|African=y|Middle-Eastern=y|Muslim=y}} {{WikiProject Egypt|class=GA|importance=High}} {{WikiProject Middle Ages|class=GA|importance=Mid}} {{WikiProject Syria|class=GA|importance=Mid}} }} == Untitled == I have started a separate article for [[Tulunids]] - a lot of the stuff here (from 'Collapse of the Dynasty' onwards) could be merged into that, since it's not directly relevant to Ahmad ibn Tulun himself. Also [[Khumarawaih]] is a separate person and should have his own entry, not be redirected here. There is a separte article for the mosque ([[Mosque of Ibn Tulun]]), and quite of lot of stuff could be moved there. == Copyvio? == {{tl|cv-unsure|Brim|26468543}} I'm not sure about these, but they're awfully suspect. [[Ahmad ibn Tulun]] ([{{SERVER}}{{localurl: Ahmad ibn Tulun|action=history}} history] · [{{SERVER}}{{localurl: Ahmad ibn Tulun|diff=0}} last edit]) and [[Mosque of Amr]] ([{{SERVER}}{{localurl: Mosque of Amr|action=history}} history] · [{{SERVER}}{{localurl: Mosque of Amr|diff=0}} last edit]). Both by the same author. Both had "By A.I MAKKI" at the top of the article. I was unable to locate online sources for either of these articles, but searching for "By A.I MAKKI" returns a ton of hits, such as [http://members.tripod.com/maseeh1/advices7/id186.htm] and [http://www.alshindagah.com/papyrus.html], suggesting that the legitimate author is a writer somewhere, and that these works are copied. I didn't place the copyvio notice on the pages since I can't find a source, but if anyone else is able to come up with anything, feel free to add the notice. —[[User:Brim|Brim]] ---- The author, as you mention, is awfully prolific, and never sources any of his articles - he's either a genuis with total ability to recall minute detail, or he's writing research papers without citing his sources (which in academia we like to call "plagiarism"). More to the point with his article is that very little of it is about Ibn Tulun himself - most of it is about the [[Mosque of Ibn Tulun|mosque]], which has its own page. The text isn't wikified, and while overflowing with detail, it's not well written. If it is kept, it needs an awful lot of editing. (And I'm not just saying that because I contributed to the Temp page). [[User:Khowaga|Khowaga]] 18:16, 25 April 2006 (UTC) :I have deleted the article and replaced it with the temp page written by Khowaga. Accordingly I've un-transcluded Brim's cv-unsure template above. Thanks to all. [[User:Chick Bowen|Chick Bowen]] 15:55, 9 May 2006 (UTC) == Update assessment to GA in WikiProjects? == Shouldn't the WikiProjects be updated to GA? [[User:Adamdaley|Adamdaley]] ([[User talk:Adamdaley|talk]]) 00:36, 19 December 2015 (UTC) :Looks like someone forgot it during closing. Fixed it. [[User:Cplakidas|Constantine]] [[User talk:Cplakidas| ✍ ]] 12:44, 19 December 2015 (UTC)
